events.message: The policyholder reported a collision involving their car and another vehicle at a traffic intersection yesterday afternoon.
The claim has been categorised under auto accident based on the keywords provided by the customer during the initial filing.
An agent was assigned to the claim to establish contact with the customer and begin assessment procedures promptly.
The customer received an acknowledgment of their claim with assurances that the investigation will begin shortly.
The agent requested copies of the police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and a copy of the driving license from the claimant.
The customer submitted all requested documents including the police report, photos of the accident scene, and insurance papers.
A thorough investigation into the cause of the collision was initiated, involving contacting witnesses and reviewing traffic camera footage.
The investigation concluded that the claimant was not at fault and that the other vehicle violated traffic signals at the intersection.
Based on investigation results, a settlement offer covering full vehicle repairs and a rental car was proposed to the claimant.
The claimant expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and appreciated the quick resolution of their auto accident claim.
The claim was officially approved by the claims department confirming acceptance of the terms proposed to the customer.
The payment for vehicle repairs and additional expenses was issued promptly as per the approved claim settlement agreement.
The auto accident claim was closed after final confirmation from the claimant that all issues had been satisfactorily resolved.
All claim documentation was archived securely to maintain records and comply with regulatory and company policy requirements.
